subpara1.lp.txt: take in relation to any document, cargo or article seized under paragraph (b) any other steps that may appear necessary for preserving the document, cargo or article and preventing interference with it.

subreg.lp.txt: A person may only be searched under this section by a person who is of the same sex.
If a person is empowered under this section to enter any premises, ship, aircraft or vehicle, the person may use any force that is reasonably necessary for that purpose.

reg.title: Detention of documents, cargoes or articles seized

subreg.lp.txt: Subject to subsection (2), any document, cargo or article seized under section 32(3) may not be detained for more than 3 months.

If the document, cargo or article is relevant to an offence under this Regulation, and proceedings for the offence have begun, the document, cargo or article may be detained until the completion of those proceedings.

reg.title: Disclosure of information or documents

subreg.lp.txt: Any information or document provided, produced or seized under this Regulation may be disclosed only if—

subpara1.label: (a)
subpara1.lp.txt: the person who provided or produced the information or document or from whom the document was seized has given consent to the disclosure;

subpara1.label: (b)
subpara1.lp.txt: the information or document is disclosed to a person who would have been empowered under this Regulation to request that it be provided or produced;

subpara1.label: (c)
subpara1.lp.txt: the information or document is disclosed on the authority of the Chief Executive, subject to the information or document being transmitted through and with the approval of the instructing authority, to—

subpara2.label: (i)
subpara2.lp.txt: any organ of the United Nations;

subpara2.label: (ii)
subpara2.lp.txt: any person in the service of the United Nations; or

subpara2.label: (iii)
subpara2.lp.txt: the Government of any place outside the People’s Republic of China,

subpara1.lp.txt: for the purpose of assisting the United Nations or that Government in securing compliance with, or detecting evasion of, measures in relation to Iran decided on by the Security Council; or

subpara1.label: (d)
subpara1.lp.txt: the information or document is disclosed with a view to the institution of, or otherwise for the purposes of, any proceedings for an offence under this Regulation.

subreg.lp.txt: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)—

subpara1.label: (a)
subpara1.lp.txt: a person may not give consent to the disclosure if the person has obtained the information or possessed the document only in the person’s capacity as servant or agent of another person; and

subpara1.label: (b)
subpara1.lp.txt: a person may give consent to the disclosure if the person is entitled to the information or to the possession of the document in the person’s own right.

reg.title: Liability of persons other than principal offenders

subreg.lp.txt: If the person convicted of an offence under this Regulation is a body corporate and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect on the part of, any director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate, the director, manager, secretary or other similar officer is guilty of the like offence.

If the person convicted of an offence under this Regulation is a firm and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect on the part of, any partner in the firm or any person concerned in the management of the firm, the partner or the person concerned in the management of the firm is guilty of the like offence.

reg.title: Offences in relation to obstruction of authorized persons, etc.
reg.lp.txt: A person who obstructs another person (including a person acting under the authority of an authorized officer) in the exercise of the powers of that other person under this Regulation commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

reg.title: Offences in relation to evasion of this Regulation
reg.lp.txt: A person who destroys, mutilates, defaces, secretes or removes any document, cargo or article with intent to evade any of the provisions of this Regulation commits an offence and is liable—

subpara1.label: (a)
subpara1.lp.txt: on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

subpara1.label: (b)
subpara1.lp.txt: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

reg.title: Consent and time limit for proceedings

subreg.lp.txt: Proceedings for an offence under this Regulation may only be instituted by or with the consent of the Secretary for Justice.

Summary proceedings for an offence under this Regulation that is alleged to have been committed outside the HKSAR may be commenced at any time not later than 12 months from the date on which the person charged first enters the HKSAR after the alleged commission of the offence.

reg.title: Specification of relevant person or relevant entity by Chief Executive
reg.lp.txt: The Chief Executive may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify as a relevant person or a relevant entity any of the following persons or entities—

subpara1.label: (a)
subpara1.lp.txt: a person or entity specified on the list established and maintained by the Committee pursuant to Resolution 1737 as of 20 July 2015, other than—

subpara2.label: (i)
subpara2.lp.txt: a person or entity specified in the Attachment to Annex B to Resolution 2231; or

subpara2.label: (ii)
subpara2.lp.txt: a person or entity de-listed by the Security Council;

subpara1.label: (b)
subpara1.lp.txt: a person or entity designated by the Security Council for the purposes of paragraph 6(c) of Annex B to Resolution 2231.

reg.title: Access to Security Council documents
reg.lp.txt: The Director-General of Trade and Industry is to make available at his or her office, for inspection by the public during normal office hours, free of charge, an English version and a Chinese version of each of the following documents—

subpara1.label: (a)
subpara1.lp.txt: the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 12/Part 1;

subpara1.label: (b)
subpara1.lp.txt: the International Atomic Energy Agency document INFCIRC/254/Rev. 9/Part 2;

subpara1.label: (c)
subpara1.lp.txt: the Security Council document S/2015/546.

reg.title: Exercise of powers of Chief Executive

subreg.lp.txt: The Chief Executive may delegate any of the Chief Executive’s powers or functions under this Regulation to any person or class or description of person.
The Chief Executive may authorize a person to whom a power or function is delegated to sub-delegate it to any other person or class or description of person.
A delegation or authorization under subsection (1) or (2) may be subject to any restrictions or conditions that the Chief Executive thinks fit.
